intro: Tarenna pilosa var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves with hairy surfaces, and small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
